skill.description: Token-efficient library documentation fetcher using Context7 MCP with 86.8% token savings through intelligent shell pipeline filtering. Fetches code examples, API references, and best practices for JavaScript, Python, Go, Rust, and other libraries. security_audit.summary: Legitimate documentation fetcher using Context7 MCP. Makes HTTP requests to MCP servers and executes npx commands as documented. No credential theft, data exfiltration, or hidden capabilities detected. Minor concern: shell=True in subprocess calls for npx commands is standard practice but could theoretically allow injection if command parameters were user-controlled (they are not).

content.user_title: Fetch library docs with 86% token savings
content.value_statement: Documentation requests consume excessive tokens. This skill uses Context7 MCP with intelligent shell pipeline filtering to extract only code examples and API signatures, reducing token usage by 86.8% while preserving all essential information.
actual_capabilities: Resolve library names to Context7 IDs automatically
Fetch documentation for any supported library (React, Next.js, Prisma, Express, MongoDB, and 200+ more)
Extract code examples using shell pipeline filtering (awk, grep, sed)
Extract API signatures and function declarations
Filter output to show only essential content (code + signatures + notes)
Support both code mode (examples) and info mode (concepts)
limitations: Requires Context7 MCP server running (local or remote)
Only works with libraries supported by Context7
Shell pipeline filtering may miss context-specific nuances
Token savings depend on documentation size and filtering parameters

faq.question: Which libraries are supported?
faq.answer: Context7 supports 200+ libraries including React, Next.js, Prisma, Express, MongoDB, FastAPI, Django, Vue, Svelte, and more.

faq.question: How much token savings can I expect?
faq.answer: Typical savings are 77-87% compared to raw documentation. A 934-token response reduces to about 205 tokens.

faq.question: Do I need to install Context7 separately?
faq.answer: The skill includes scripts to start a local Context7 MCP server using npx. Run start-server.sh first.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: The MCP server connects to Context7's cloud service. Documentation requests are sent to Anthropic's cloud infrastructure.

faq.question: Why use shell pipeline instead of Python filtering?
faq.answer: Shell tools (awk, grep, sed) run in subprocess memory, keeping full documentation out of LLM context for maximum token savings.

faq.question: How is this different from other documentation skills?
faq.answer: This skill uses shell pipeline filtering to keep large documentation payloads entirely in subprocess memory, never sending them to the LLM.
